intro: Neurolaena macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, yellow to orange flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Neurolaena macrocephala is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
